decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a strong board presence with powerful elf creatures like Elvish Champion and Imperious Perfect. Utilizing cards like Llanowar Elves and Boreal Druid for ramp, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and removal spells like Eyeblight's Ending. With strong support from cards like Garruk Wildspeaker and Wren's Run Packmaster, the deck can generate a significant advantage in the mid to late game, ultimately leading to a swift victory.

This deck focuses on generating tempo by utilizing cards that allow for repeated value and disruption. By using efficient creatures like Wall of Roots and Birds of Paradise to ramp, and cards like Momentary Blink to recur enter-the-battlefield effects, the deck aims to control the board while building its own presence. The inclusion of counter spells like Mystic Snake and Draining Whelk also adds an element of disruption, allowing the deck to protect its strategy while staying ahead of the opponent. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient plays and resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board with removal spells like Wrath of God and Condemn, while gaining life with Martyr of Sands and using Sacred Mesa to create flying tokens. The deck also aims to draw cards with Aeon Chronicler and Jace Beleren, and utilize Snow-Covered lands for synergy with Scrying Sheets. Overall, the deck focuses on stabilizing the board, gaining life, and drawing cards to outvalue the opponent in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on utilizing creatures with strong abilities and combat prowess to control the battlefield while generating card advantage through Masked Admirers and Venser, Shaper Savant. The deck also includes counterspells like Familiar's Ruse and Mystic Snake to disrupt opponent's plays. The inclusion of Garruk Wildspeaker allows for ramp and token generation, while Loxodon Warhammer provides additional power and lifegain. The deck aims to outvalue opponents through efficient creature plays and versatile spellcasting.

This deck focuses on aggressive red and green spells that deal direct damage to the opponent, while also utilizing mana ramp and creature support to maintain board presence. The combination of burn spells like Incinerate and creature threats like Bogardan Hellkite and Hostility allows the player to apply pressure and control the battlefield. Additionally, the inclusion of mana acceleration with cards like Birds of Paradise and Garruk Wildspeaker enables the player to quickly cast powerful spells like Spectral Force and Akroma, Angel of Fury to overpower their opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive red creatures like Mogg Fanatic and Keldon Marauders, supported by powerful red burn spells like Lash Out and Psionic Blast. The inclusion of blue spells like Sower of Temptation and Venser, Shaper Savant adds control elements to the deck. The use of counter spells like Rune Snag and Delay help protect the deck's threats while the presence of Sulfur Elemental gives the deck a way to deal with white creatures. Overall, this deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the battlefield.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and resources using cards like Thoughtseize, Stupor, and Smallpox to control the game. The Rack and Tarmogoyf are used to apply pressure and finish off the opponent quickly. Augur of Skulls and Oona's Prowler provide additional discard and creature threats, while Call of the Herd generates token creatures. The deck also includes removal spells like Terror and Damnation to deal with opposing threats. The mana base includes black and green sources to support the deck's spells and creatures effectively.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan through counter spells and removal. It looks to stall the game with cards like Wrath of God and Condemn while generating card advantage with Think Twice and Ponder. The win condition comes from utilizing flying creatures like Sower of Temptation and Faerie Conclave to chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes some finishers like Akroma, Angel of Wrath and Sacred Mesa for closing out games.

This deck focuses on creating a powerful elf tribal synergy, utilizing cards like Elvish Champion and Imperious Perfect to boost the strength of your elf creatures. Gaea's Anthem provides additional anthem effects, while cards like Essence Warden help to gain life and stay ahead on the board. The inclusion of Garruk Wildspeaker and Overrun allows for a strong finish with a sudden boost of power. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful elf creatures and utilize various anthem effects to secure victory.

This deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value by utilizing cards like Nantuko Husk and Greater Gargadon. It also takes advantage of hand disruption with Thoughtseize, burn spells like Incinerate and a tribal goblin theme with cards such as Mogg War Marshal and Siege-Gang Commander. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while also maintaining a board presence through sacrificing creatures for various effects. The deck's strategy revolves around tempo and resource management to outpace opponents and secure victory.

This deck focuses on a strong midrange strategy, utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Troll Ascetic to control the board. Removal spells like Damnation and Nameless Inversion provide flexibility in dealing with threats. Thoughtseize helps disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Call of the Herd and Spike Feeder provide value and resilience. The deck also features some lifegain and card draw spells to maintain card advantage and stay ahead in the game. The mana base is designed to support a smooth curve and consistent mana production.

This deck focuses on utilizing various Sliver creatures to swarm the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent. By combining abilities such as tapping for mana, giving haste, dealing direct damage, and granting poison counters, the Slivers create a versatile and aggressive strategy. The inclusion of Dormant Sliver allows for card draw while protecting the player's board. With a mix of land manipulation and creature support, this deck aims to quickly build a strong presence on the battlefield and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on control and card advantage through spells like Careful Consideration, Cryptic Command, and Mystical Teachings. It also utilizes creature removal with Damnation and Shriekmaw, as well as potential recursion with Haakon, Stromgald Scourge and Grim Harvest. The mana base includes various land options to ensure smooth casting of spells, while also providing access to different colors of mana. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient spell usage and card advantage, while maintaining control of the game with counterspells and removal.

This deck focuses on control and tempo by countering opponent's spells, bouncing their permanents, and disrupting their game plan. It aims to outvalue opponents with card advantage and efficient removal while locking them out of important plays with Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir. The combo of Vesuvan+Shapeshifter','','');">Vesuvan Shapeshifter and Brine Elemental can also provide a win condition by keeping opponents from untapping their lands. Overall, it seeks to control the game and gradually wear down opponents' resources until it can secure a victory.

The focus of this deck is to control the board through counterspells and bounce effects, while also being able to generate card advantage with blink spells and draw spells. By utilizing creatures with morph abilities, the deck can maintain tempo and surprise the opponent with powerful interactions. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and gradually pull ahead through incremental advantage, eventually overwhelming them with powerful threats like Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir and Brine Elemental. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining control and outvaluing the opponent.

The deck focuses on aggressive white weenies supported by removal and equipment to quickly overwhelm opponents. By using low-cost creatures with abilities that benefit each other, combined with removal spells to deal with threats, the deck aims to establish board control early on. The inclusion of powerful equipment such as Loxodon Warhammer further enhances the deck's ability to maintain pressure and close out games efficiently. Ajani Goldmane serves as a powerful finisher and provides additional support for the deck's aggressive strategy.
